noun.description: A worker at a building site who supervises the use of vehicles and heavy machinery.
examples: the driver had no banksman to help him before he reversed

noun.description: A person who works at the mouth of a mine shaft or pit, supervising the loading of coal and the lowering and raising of the cage.
examples: a banksman was at the top of the shaft

origin: Late 16th century (in banksman (sense 2)): from bank in the sense area surrounding the top of a shaft or the mouth of a pit + man.
